thread.title: Samoa Observer | 'God's guidance and parents support': St Mary's Dux
thread.title_full: Samoa Observer | 'God's guidance and parents support': St Mary's Dux

author: Faith Leapai
title: Samoa Observer | 'God's guidance and parents support': St Mary's Dux
text:
At just 16-years-old, Fotumanaia Neriala Meleisea is St. Mary’s College 2024 Dux. She believes this is the fruit of her faith and guidance from her parents.
She said as she moves forward in life, she will be stronger and more diligent. The teenager has not specifically chosen a career path but said she would consider becoming a biochemical engineer.
"I stand before you as Saint Mary's Dux of 2024 with a heart full of thankfulness, and I sincerely thank the Lord for this wonderful accomplishment," she said in her valedictorian speech.
“I am incredibly appreciative of Saint Mary's for moulding and nurturing me in ways I never could have predicted. I also want to express my gratitude to all teachers who have played a crucial role in my path.
“I appreciate you challenging me every day and sharing your expertise and knowledge. In this household, you have served as both second parents and teachers.
“As you have done for the graduating class of 2024, I am confident that the impact you all possess will continue to help my younger sisters and others realise their greatest potential."
Fotumanaia said her parents have moulded the person she is. She said they were always there supporting her even when she doubted herself.
“You have supported my aspirations and given me patient, wise, and loving guidance in addition to investing in my education. Beyond only meeting my tangible necessities, you have given me your heart, your sacrifices, and your unending support," she said.
Fotumanaia believes that the sisterhood at St Mary's College has an important to play in each student's success.
“Thank you to my lovely sisters in the graduating class of 2024 for making Saint Mary's such a special place. You've all helped create something genuinely unique here, through every obstacle, every accomplishment, and every experience that will never be forgotten,” she said.
 “Sharing this journey with you has been an honour. Congratulations on achieving this amazing goal! You are where you are now because of your diligence, commitment, and fortitude.”
Her father Peti Maleisea, and mother Ala Maleisea beamed with pride as Fotumanaia walked up to receive her award. The family shed tears of joy and are planning a celebration for this achievement.
